results.title: Looking up down under
results.creator_credit: Michael Hollander, ABC-TV (Australia), Open Learning Agency of Australia and Monash University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Astronomy: an Open Learning unit”.
Telescopes provide our gateway to the stars. The study of astronomy relies heavily on telescopes and has done so for many centuries. Australia is in a unique position for studying the heavens, given its location in the Southern Hemisphere and its relatively small population. This program looks at the history of Astronomy in Australia.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Hollander, ABC-TV (Australia), Open Learning Agency of Australia and Monash University

results.title: From the heart
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Hossein Valamanesh
results.brief_description: Using 35mm footage capturing his own angiogram, Hossein Valamanesh creates a mysterious, luminescent universe which hovers, like a heartbeat, between biology and the sublime.
results.description: Using 35mm footage capturing his own angiogram, Hossein Valamanesh creates a mysterious, luminescent universe which hovers, like a heartbeat, between biology and the sublime.

results.title: Knit-face
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Janet Merewether
results.brief_description: Janet Merewether’s comic portrait series of knitted dolls illuminates the unpredictable, shabby beauty of found objects and gleefully appreciates the individual, creative application of this traditional craft form.

results.title: Ost offic
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Helen Grace
results.brief_description: Helen Grace reworks images of a disused rural post office and repurposes found footage in this poetic meditation on the fragility of civic space.

results.title: Thailand: a land of smiles
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Asian Notebook”
Presents traditional aspects of the culture of Thailand. Discusses the geography, emphasising the importance of water for travel and agriculture. Shows dances, festivals, handicrafts, and the influence of religion on Thailand’s culture.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Asian Notebook”

results.title: ARTV
results.brief_description:
The Australian Centre for the Moving Image and SBS Independent will commission 16 artists to produce works for ARTV, an exhibition program which will be broadcast on SBS and shown on screens throughout ACMI concurrently, commencing on 8 June 2004.

ARTV is part of 2004, a survey exhibition of contemporary Australian visual culture presented by the Australian Centre for the Moving Image and the National Gallery of Victoria.

results.title: Bali: island of temples
results.creator_credit: Deben Bhattacharya, John Seabourne and Bay Street Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Asian Notebook”.
Shows how the every day lives of the Balinese is affected by the geography of the island and the Hindu attitude to the land.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Deben Bhattacharya, John Seabourne and Bay Street Productions

results.title: Whitefellanormal
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Vernon Ah Kee
results.brief_description: Vernon Ah Kee’s seething representation of contemporary Australian black/white politics playfully uses language, moving text and self-portraiture to deadly serious effect.
results.creator_credit_for_label: SBS Independent, ACMI and Vernon Ah Kee

results.title: Silk and strings: a tale of Taiwan
results.creator_credit: Seabourne Enterprises and Bay Street Pictures Inc
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Asian Notebook”.
Presents traditional aspects of Taiwanese culture. Contrasts the simple life, costumes, and art and crafts of the original natives of Taiwan with the culture of the Chinese. Focuses on the traditions of China as they are retained in Taiwan, including the cultivation of the arts, music, and calligraphy.
results.title_for_label: Silk and strings: a tale of Taiwan
results.creator_credit_for_label: Seabourne Enterprises and Bay Street Pictures Inc
